titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Corporation, Counsel FA870

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-11 20:02:02 -0400.

revisiondesc.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Starr J. Murphy served as first counsel to the Board of Trustees until his death in 1921.
Aubin L. Boulware served as counsel from 1921 through June 1923.
Thomas McElrath Debevoise served as counsel from September 1924 through 1958, with Chauncey Belknap as associate counsel 1934-1947 and Vanderbilt Webb, 1942-1948.
John Edward Lockwood served as associate counsel 1947-1959, when he became counsel and served until 1968/1969.
Donal Clare O'Brien served as associate counsel 1955/1956 until he became counsel in 1969/1970.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for scholarly research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily correspondence with the Business Manager, but includes some items with T. Mitchell Prudden, Simon Flexner and L. Emmett Holt, where legal advice is needed. Between 1915 and 1922 there is a sprinkling of correspondence with Claudius Hand (Assistant) particularly on tax matters. Claudius Hand resigned at the death of Starr J. Murphy.

Included are letters on Rockefeller pledges, permissions granted in use of Rockefeller land money requisitions made for Hospital construction and equipment; correspondence in relation to acquisition of land and construction at Princeton and information concerning Farmers' cooperative of Mercer County and the development of the War Demonstration Hospital.

Includes correspondence dealing with the business affars of the Institute such as insurance, lease at Wood's Hole, requests for abatement of water taxes, other taxation questions, closing of streets and paving matters.
Included are some copies of meeting notices; some sealed copies of motions passed at meetings; some letters transmitting minutes; budget committee actions; legal proceedings.

Starr J. Murphy died April 1921. There are copies of letters sent from the Scientific Directors to his widow. 1921 June 2 to 1922 March 16 there is some correspondence between the Business Manager and Starr J. Murphy office staff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of correspondence with Edric B. Smith, Business Manager on legal questions arising in the conduct of Institute affairs. Includes questions of tax payments on water use or property; requests for tax exemptions; questions of trademark on Luetin; amendments to By-laws and Rules; leases on Princeton houses; correspondence to be presented at Trustees' meetings. Includes some copies of Minutes adopted at Trustees' meetings. Some correspondence with Mr. Belknap in the absensce of Mr. Debevoise.
Some correspondence with Simon Flexner incuding a few personal communications dealing with medical examinations and times of illness.
